data.title: Grant Tree Talk (Kings Canyon)
data.description:
What is the significance of sequoia trees? Meet at the General Grant Tree for this ranger-led talk.

 Accessibility: This trail features tactile information panels, with raised illustrations and Braille text. While paved, the trail has steep sections and is not designated as wheelchair-accessible. A separate short trail that leads around the General Grant Tree includes stairs, but can be bypassed to complete the loop. Benches are placed in pullouts along the trails.

There is one accessible parking space, accessible flush restrooms, and drinking fountains at the trailhead.
data.location: Meet at the base of the General Grant Tree.

images.altText: A tall reddish brown sequoia tree stands behind a wooden sign labeled "the general grant tree".
images.caption: The General Grant Tree, named after a famous Civil War General, is also our nation's Christmas tree.

data.title: Grant Tree Talk (Kings Canyon)
data.description:
What is the significance of sequoia trees? Meet at the General Grant Tree for this ranger-led talk.

 Accessibility: This trail features tactile information panels, with raised illustrations and Braille text. While paved, the trail has steep sections and is not designated as wheelchair-accessible. A separate short trail that leads around the General Grant Tree includes stairs, but can be bypassed to complete the loop. Benches are placed in pullouts along the trails.

There is one accessible parking space, accessible flush restrooms, and drinking fountains at the trailhead.
data.location: Meet at the base of the General Grant Tree.

1 hour, 0.5 mile (0.8km)
Meet at Grant Tree Trailhead

Accessibility: This trail features tactile information panels, with raised illustrations and Braille text. While paved, the trail has steep sections and is not designated as wheelchair-accessible. A separate short trail that leads around the General Grant Tree includes stairs, but can be bypassed to complete the loop. Benches are placed in pullouts along the trails.

There is one accessible parking space, accessible flush restrooms, and drinking fountains at the trailhead.

Join a guided walk learning about meadows, giant sequoias, and more.

 

1.5 hours, 1.5 mi.(2.4km), paved path

100ft (30m) elevation change

Meet at the Giant Forest Museum.

data.title: Grant Tree Talk (Kings Canyon)
data.description:
What is the significance of sequoia trees? Meet at the General Grant Tree for this ranger-led talk.

 Accessibility: This trail features tactile information panels, with raised illustrations and Braille text. While paved, the trail has steep sections and is not designated as wheelchair-accessible. A separate short trail that leads around the General Grant Tree includes stairs, but can be bypassed to complete the loop. Benches are placed in pullouts along the trails.

There is one accessible parking space, accessible flush restrooms, and drinking fountains at the trailhead.
data.location: Meet at the base of the General Grant Tree.

images.altText: A tall reddish brown sequoia tree stands behind a wooden sign labeled "the general grant tree".
images.caption: The General Grant Tree, named after a famous Civil War General, is also our nation's Christmas tree.

data.title: Grant Tree Talk (Kings Canyon)
data.description:
What is the significance of sequoia trees? Meet at the General Grant Tree for this ranger-led talk.

 Accessibility: This trail features tactile information panels, with raised illustrations and Braille text. While paved, the trail has steep sections and is not designated as wheelchair-accessible. A separate short trail that leads around the General Grant Tree includes stairs, but can be bypassed to complete the loop. Benches are placed in pullouts along the trails.

There is one accessible parking space, accessible flush restrooms, and drinking fountains at the trailhead.
data.location: Meet at the base of the General Grant Tree.

images.altText: A tall reddish brown sequoia tree stands behind a wooden sign labeled "the general grant tree".
images.caption: The General Grant Tree, named after a famous Civil War General, is also our nation's Christmas tree.
